required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: A Phase III Double-Blind, Randomized, Multicenter Study to Evaluate the Safety, Tolerability, and Immunogenicity of ZOSTAVAX™ Administered Concomitantly Versus Nonconcomitantly With PNEUMOVAX™ 23 in Subjects 60 Years of Age and Older

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine whether Zoster Vaccine Live and Pneumococcal Vaccine, polyvalent are as well tolerated and immunogenic when the vaccines are given together (in different body sites), as when they are given alone, in adults 60 years of age and older.

primary_outcome.measure: Geometric Mean Titer (GMT) of Varicella-zoster Virus (VZV) Antibody Responses at 4 Weeks Postvaccination
primary_outcome.description: GMT of the VZV antibody responses at 4 weeks postvaccination in subjects who receive ZOSTAVAX™ concomitantly with PNEUMOVAX™ 23 and those who receive ZOSTAVAX™ and PNEUMOVAX™ 23 nonconcomitantly. *gpELISA = glycoprotein enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay

primary_outcome.measure: Geometric Mean Fold Rise (GMFR) of the Varicella-zoster Virus (VZV) Antibody Responses From Day 1 to 4 Weeks Postvaccination.
primary_outcome.description: GMFR of the VZV antibody response from prevaccination to Week 4 postvaccination in subjects who receive ZOSTAVAX™ concomitantly with PNEUMOVAX™ 23. gpELISA = glycoprotein enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay.

primary_outcome.measure: Geometric Mean Titer (GMT) of the Pneumococcal Polysaccharide (PnPs) Serotype 3 Antibody Response at 4 Weeks Postvaccination.
primary_outcome.description: GMT of the PnPs serotype 3 antibody response at 4 weeks postvaccination in subjects who receive ZOSTAVAX™ concomitantly with PNEUMOVAX™ 23 and those who receive ZOSTAVAX™ and PNEUMOVAX™ 23 nonconcomitantly.

primary_outcome.measure: Geometric Mean Titer (GMT) of the Pneumococcal Polysaccharide (PnPs) Serotype 14 Antibody Response at 4 Weeks Postvaccination.
primary_outcome.description: GMT of the PnPs serotype 14 antibody response at 4 weeks postvaccination in subjects who receive ZOSTAVAX™ concomitantly with PNEUMOVAX™ 23 and those who receive ZOSTAVAX™ and PNEUMOVAX™ 23 nonconcomitantly.

primary_outcome.measure: Geometric Mean Titer (GMT) of the Pneumococcal Polysaccharide (PnPs) Serotype 19A Antibody Response at 4 Weeks Postvaccination.
primary_outcome.description: GMT of the PnPs serotype 19A antibody response at 4 weeks postvaccination in subjects who receive ZOSTAVAX™ concomitantly with PNEUMOVAX™ 23 and those who receive ZOSTAVAX™ and PNEUMOVAX™ 23 nonconcomitantly.

primary_outcome.measure: Geometric Mean Titer (GMT) of the Pneumococcal Polysaccharide (PnPs) Serotype 22F Antibody Response at 4 Weeks Postvaccination.
primary_outcome.description: GMT of the PnPs serotype 22F antibody response at 4 weeks postvaccination in subjects who receive ZOSTAVAX™ concomitantly with PNEUMOVAX™ 23 and those who receive ZOSTAVAX™ and PNEUMOVAX™ 23 nonconcomitantly.

secondary_outcome.measure: Safety and Tolerability of Both Vaccines When Administered Concomitantly.
secondary_outcome.description: All adverse events were analyzed including serious adverse events; injection-site adverse events; Vaccination Report Card prompted systemic adverse events, including varicella-like rashes or herpes zoster-like rashes; all other systemic adverse events.

intervention.description: 0.65 mL injection Zoster Vaccine, Live, (Oka-Merck) over 4 week vaccination period
Pneumococcal Vaccine, Polyvalent (23-valent) 0.5 mL Placebo injection over 4 week vaccination period.
Pneumococcal Vaccine, Polyvalent (23-valent) 0.5 mL injection over 4 week vaccination period.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 60 years of age or older
- Stable underlying conditions
- Postmenopausal if female
- Afebrile
Exclusion Criteria:
- Previously vaccinated with either vaccine
- Immune deficiency
- History of allergy to components in either vaccine
- Concomitant antiviral therapy

results_reference.citation: MacIntyre CR, Egerton T, McCaughey M, Parrino J, Campbell BV, Su SC, Pagnoni MF, Stek JE, Xu J, Annunziato PW, Chan IS, Silber JL. Concomitant administration of zoster and pneumococcal vaccines in adults ≥60 years old. Hum Vaccin. 2010 Nov;6(11):894-902. Epub 2010 Nov 1.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Phase III First subject enrolled on 18-Jun-2007. Last subject enrolled on 05-Dec-2007. The last subject's last visit was 11-Feb-2008. The study was conducted at 18 study centers throughout Canada, Australia, and Europe.

group.title: Nonconcomitant Group
group.description: Subjects were administered PNEUMOVAX™ 23 intramuscularly on Day 1 followed by ZOSTAVAX™ subcutaneously on Week 4

group.title: Concomitant Group
group.description: Subjects were administered ZOSTAVAX™ subcutaneously concomitantly with PNEUMOVAX™ 23 intramuscularly at separate injection sites at Day 1

participants_list.participants: Two subjects were allocated but not vaccinated making the number of subjects vaccinated 235

group.title: Nonconcomitant Group
group.description: Subjects were administered PNEUMOVAX™ 23 intramuscularly on Day 1 followed by ZOSTAVAX™ subcutaneously on Week 4

group.title: Concomitant Group
group.description: Subjects were administered ZOSTAVAX™ subcutaneously concomitantly with PNEUMOVAX™ 23 intramuscularly at separate injection sites at Day 1

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcome.title: Geometric Mean Titer (GMT) of Varicella-zoster Virus (VZV) Antibody Responses at 4 Weeks Postvaccination
outcome.description: GMT of the VZV antibody responses at 4 weeks postvaccination in subjects who receive ZOSTAVAX™ concomitantly with PNEUMOVAX™ 23 and those who receive ZOSTAVAX™ and PNEUMOVAX™ 23 nonconcomitantly. *gpELISA = glycoprotein enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay
outcome.population: Analysis was per protocol. The following protocol violations resulted in exclusion of subjects from analysis: receipt of prohibited medications; vaccine temperature compromised prior to administration; excluded medical condition; samples collected outside of Statistical Analysis Plan specified time window; exposure to herpes zoster (HZ) or VZV.

group.title: Nonconcomitant Group
group.description: Subjects were administered PNEUMOVAX™ 23 intramuscularly on Day 1 followed by ZOSTAVAX™ subcutaneously on Week 4

group.title: Concomitant Group
group.description: Subjects were administered ZOSTAVAX™ subcutaneously concomitantly with PNEUMOVAX™ 23 intramuscularly at separate injection sites at Day 1

measure.title: Geometric Mean Titer (GMT) of Varicella-zoster Virus (VZV) Antibody Responses at 4 Weeks Postvaccination
measure.description: GMT of the VZV antibody responses at 4 weeks postvaccination in subjects who receive ZOSTAVAX™ concomitantly with PNEUMOVAX™ 23 and those who receive ZOSTAVAX™ and PNEUMOVAX™ 23 nonconcomitantly. *gpELISA = glycoprotein enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay
measure.population: Analysis was per protocol. The following protocol violations resulted in exclusion of subjects from analysis: receipt of prohibited medications; vaccine temperature compromised prior to administration; excluded medical condition; samples collected outside of Statistical Analysis Plan specified time window; exposure to herpes zoster (HZ) or VZV.

analysis.groups_desc: The hypothesis was that the GMT of the VZV antibody responses at 4 weeks postvaccination in subjects who receive ZOSTAVAX™ concomitantly with PNEUMOVAX™ 23 will be noninferior to that in subjects who receive ZOSTAVAX™ nonconcomitantly
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: The power for the noninferiority hypothesis of VZV antibody titers is 92%. The noninferiority margin is the lower bound of the two-sided 95% confidence interval on the VZV antibody GMT ratio[concomitant/nonconcomitant] being >0.67.
analysis.p_value_desc: The threshold for statistical significance is 0.025. There is no adjustment for multiple comparisons.
analysis.method_desc: Week 4 postvac, estimated responses, GMT ratio, 95% CI, p-value based on a longitudinal regression model adjusting for prevac titers and age (years)

outcome.title: Safety and Tolerability of Both Vaccines When Administered Concomitantly.
outcome.description: All adverse events were analyzed including serious adverse events; injection-site adverse events; Vaccination Report Card prompted systemic adverse events, including varicella-like rashes or herpes zoster-like rashes; all other systemic adverse events.
outcome.population: All subjects who received at least one vaccination

group.title: Nonconcomitant Group
group.description: Subjects were administered PNEUMOVAX™ 23 intramuscularly on Day 1 followed by ZOSTAVAX™ subcutaneously on Week 4

group.title: Concomitant Group
group.description: Subjects were administered ZOSTAVAX™ subcutaneously concomitantly with PNEUMOVAX™ 23 intramuscularly at separate injection sites at Day 1

measure.title: Safety and Tolerability of Both Vaccines When Administered Concomitantly.
measure.description: All adverse events were analyzed including serious adverse events; injection-site adverse events; Vaccination Report Card prompted systemic adverse events, including varicella-like rashes or herpes zoster-like rashes; all other systemic adverse events.
measure.population: All subjects who received at least one vaccination

outcome.title: Geometric Mean Fold Rise (GMFR) of the Varicella-zoster Virus (VZV) Antibody Responses From Day 1 to 4 Weeks Postvaccination.
outcome.description: GMFR of the VZV antibody response from prevaccination to Week 4 postvaccination in subjects who receive ZOSTAVAX™ concomitantly with PNEUMOVAX™ 23. gpELISA = glycoprotein enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay.
outcome.population: Analysis was per protocol. The following protocol violations resulted in exclusion of subjects from analysis: receipt of prohibited medications; vaccine temperature compromised prior to administration; excluded medical condition; samples collected outside of Statistical Analysis Plan specified time window; exposure to herpes zoster (HZ) or VZV.

group.title: Concomitant Group
group.description: Subjects were administered ZOSTAVAX™ subcutaneously concomitantly with PNEUMOVAX™ 23 intramuscularly at separate injection sites at Day 1

measure.title: Geometric Mean Fold Rise (GMFR) of the Varicella-zoster Virus (VZV) Antibody Responses From Day 1 to 4 Weeks Postvaccination.
measure.description: GMFR of the VZV antibody response from prevaccination to Week 4 postvaccination in subjects who receive ZOSTAVAX™ concomitantly with PNEUMOVAX™ 23. gpELISA = glycoprotein enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay.
measure.population: Analysis was per protocol. The following protocol violations resulted in exclusion of subjects from analysis: receipt of prohibited medications; vaccine temperature compromised prior to administration; excluded medical condition; samples collected outside of Statistical Analysis Plan specified time window; exposure to herpes zoster (HZ) or VZV.

analysis.groups_desc: The hypothesis was that ZOSTAVAX™ elicits an acceptable VZV antibody response when administered concomitantly with PNEUMOVAX™ 23.
analysis.p_value_desc: The threshold for statistical significance is 0.025. There is no adjustment for multiple comparisons.
analysis.method_desc: The one-sided p-value for testing acceptability for GMFR is computed based on t-test. CI is computed based on the t distribution

outcome.title: Geometric Mean Titer (GMT) of the Pneumococcal Polysaccharide (PnPs) Serotype 3 Antibody Response at 4 Weeks Postvaccination.
outcome.description: GMT of the PnPs serotype 3 antibody response at 4 weeks postvaccination in subjects who receive ZOSTAVAX™ concomitantly with PNEUMOVAX™ 23 and those who receive ZOSTAVAX™ and PNEUMOVAX™ 23 nonconcomitantly.
outcome.population: Analysis was per protocol. The following protocol violations resulted in exclusion of subjects from analysis: prior receipt of a pneumococcal vaccine; receipt of prohibited medications; vaccine temperature compromised prior to administration; excluded medical condition; samples collected outside of Statistical Analysis Plan specified time window.

group.title: Nonconcomitant Group
group.description: Subjects were administered PNEUMOVAX™ 23 intramuscularly on Day 1 followed by ZOSTAVAX™ subcutaneously on Week 4

group.title: Concomitant Group
group.description: Subjects were administered ZOSTAVAX™ subcutaneously concomitantly with PNEUMOVAX™ 23 intramuscularly at separate injection sites at Day 1

measure.title: Geometric Mean Titer (GMT) of the Pneumococcal Polysaccharide (PnPs) Serotype 3 Antibody Response at 4 Weeks Postvaccination.
measure.description: GMT of the PnPs serotype 3 antibody response at 4 weeks postvaccination in subjects who receive ZOSTAVAX™ concomitantly with PNEUMOVAX™ 23 and those who receive ZOSTAVAX™ and PNEUMOVAX™ 23 nonconcomitantly.
measure.population: Analysis was per protocol. The following protocol violations resulted in exclusion of subjects from analysis: prior receipt of a pneumococcal vaccine; receipt of prohibited medications; vaccine temperature compromised prior to administration; excluded medical condition; samples collected outside of Statistical Analysis Plan specified time window.

analysis.groups_desc: The hypothesis was that the GMT of the PnPs antibody response to serotype 3 at 4 weeks postvaccination in subjects who receive ZOSTAVAX™ concomitantly with PNEUMOVAX™ 23 will be noninferior to those in subjects who receive ZOSTAVAX™ nonconcomitantly.
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: The power for the noninferiority hypothesis regarding PnPs antibody titer is ~99%. The noninferiority margin is the lower bound of the two-sided 95% confidence interval (CI) on the PnPs antibody GMT ratio [concomitant/nonconcomitant] being >05.
analysis.p_value_desc: The threshold for statistical significance is 0.025. There is no adjustment for multiple comparisons.
analysis.method_desc: Week 4 postvac, estimated responses, GMT ratio, 95% CI, p-value based on a longitudinal regression model adjusting for prevac titers and age (years)

outcome.title: Geometric Mean Titer (GMT) of the Pneumococcal Polysaccharide (PnPs) Serotype 14 Antibody Response at 4 Weeks Postvaccination.

outcome.population: Analysis was per protocol. category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Merck agreements may vary with individual investigators, but will not prohibit any investigator from publishing. Merck supports the publication of results from all centers of a multi-center trial but requests that reports based on single-site data not precede the primary publication of the entire clinical trial.

point_of_contact.name_or_title: Senior Vice President, Global Clinical Development
